GameEventAction.Description: We have found the shattered remains of what was once an Ancient Guardian secret Vault. It appears to have been discovered and destroyed long ago. We cannot know if this happened during the Ancient Shakturi war or if marauders plundered it in the dark ages that followed. Its secrets are lost forever, though we may yet learn something by examining ruins more carefully.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Crumbling Harbor

GameEventAction.Description: A terrible waste! Within this Vault we have discovered the ruined remains of what we believe was a research archive from the ancient galaxy. We will attempt to piece together the fragments of broken data crystals in the hopes of learning something of value.

We have found the shattered remains of what was once an Ancient Guardian secret Vault. It appears to have been discovered and destroyed long ago. We cannot know if this happened during the Ancient Shakturi war or if marauders plundered it in the dark ages that followed. Its secrets are lost forever, though we may yet learn something by examining ruins more carefully.

Its secrets are lost forever, though we may yet learn something by examining ruins more carefully.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Deteriorating Tomb

GameEventAction.Description: A terrible waste! Within this Vault we have discovered the ruined remains of what we believe was a research archive from the ancient galaxy. We will attempt to piece together the fragments of broken data crystals in the hopes of learning something of value.

We have found the shattered remains of what was once an Ancient Guardian secret Vault. It appears to have been discovered and destroyed long ago. We cannot know if this happened during the Ancient Shakturi war or if marauders plundered it in the dark ages that followed. Its secrets are lost forever, though we may yet learn something by examining ruins more carefully.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Decaying Catacomb

GameEventAction.Description: A terrible waste! Within this Vault we have discovered the ruined remains of what we believe was a research archive from the ancient galaxy. We will attempt to piece together the fragments of broken data crystals in the hopes of learning something of value.

We have discovered one of the Ancient Guardians' most significant Shakturi Vaults. The Vault of Concealment, as its name suggests, has indeed been well hidden from our enemies and pirates. To open it, we will first have to decipher a complicated lock mechanism. It is a puzzle the Ancient Guardians designed to be difficult for organic beings like ourselves, using a series of codes and mathematical formulations that are meant to be impossible for the Shakturi mind to comprehend.
We have decoded the cipher preventing us from entering the Vault of Concealment. We will now venture within.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Concealment Unlocked 2

GameEventAction.Description:
The entrance of the Vault of Concealment leads to a narrow rampway that spirals many kilometers under the surface. It leads to another doorway, protected by a cipher similar to the one that protected the main entryway. Fortunately, our research made presenting the correct code a fairly simple process.
This doorway leads to a small and spare chamber. It is difficult for more than three of our team to fit inside. The exterior walls are themselves over a quarter of a kilometer thick. This chamber was meant to withstand the most intense orbital bombardment.
Within is merely a stand with a single data crystal. Our scans revealed no traps or concealments, but when we touched the crystal, the room filled with a thick, oily gas. Our scans revealed that it is harmless to us, but we suspect it may be a genetically engineered toxin designed to target the Shakturi nervous system.
As for the data crystal itself, it contains a treasure trove of useful data on countering Shakturi psychic assaults. We will be able to put this to good use.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Concealment Unlocked 3

GameEventAction.Description:
The Vault also contains a small quantity of carefully preserved Korrabian Spice. The accompanying data informs us that this resource will be vital to the war effort. The more of it the Shakturi possess, the stronger their psychic abilities will grow. The more of it we have, the better we will be able to defend ourselves against these attacks.
Controlling Korrabian Spice and keeping it from enemy hands must be a major priority.

We have discovered one of the Ancient Guardians' most significant Shakturi Vaults. On the surface of this world we found the entrance to an underground chamber. The walls within are covered with mysterious pictograms and symbols each of which roughly suggests one of the massive space creatures found throughout the galaxy. It is as though the Ancient Guardians created an entire hieroglyphic language out of space creature morphology. Is this a game to them, or is this simply how their machine intelligence makes sense of the universe?
We believe they must be interpreted to find the means of progressing further, but even a cursory examination reveals that this is a sophisticated system designed to defy Shakturi logic. We will have to put some of our best minds on this project if we wish to open the vault.
We have decoded the cipher preventing us from entering the Vault of Creation. We will now venture within.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Creation Unlocked 2

GameEventAction.Description:
Within the Vault's antechamber, we found a small platform. Our explorers stepped onto it and were immediately bombarded with flashing lights and curious auditory bursts. We believe this was some sort of biological scan to make certain no Shakturi could proceed.
Once the scan was complete, the platform descended to another small chamber, well below the world's surface. Within we found something like a small biological laboratory. The placement of the equipment appears strange by our standards. Nothing is conveniently accessible to any known sentient species. Perhaps the laboratory is organized along principles that make sense for artificial beings.
Within the lab we found a curious figurine shaped like one of the Shakturi's genetically engineered creatures. Further inspection revealed an embedded data crystal which contains a manual of Shakturi genetic engineering practices. This should prove immensely useful in dealing with the monstrosities the Shakturi have unleashed upon the galaxy.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Creation Unlocked 3

GameEventAction.Description:
The Vault also contains a small quantity of carefully preserved Zentabia Fluid. The accompanying data informs us that this resource will be vital to the war effort. The more of it the Shakturi possess, the more dangerous their genetic creations will grow. The more of it we have, the better we will be able to defend ourselves against these creatures.
Controlling Zentabia Fluid and keeping it from enemy hands must be a major priority.

We arrived at what we believed to be the location of an Ancient Guardian Vault, and we found a blasted crater, a site of massive destruction. Fortunately, we continued our analysis and now believe that this destruction was created intentionally to conceal a still intact Ancient Guardian Vault. Believing the Vault is present and locating it are two very different things. If we wish to find our way in, we will have to launch a research project dedicated to discovering this Vault's secrets.

Our scientists have thoroughly studied the destruction on {0}, and located the entrance to the Ancient Guardian Vault of Aggression. The crater floor contained a series of artificial boulders, in most way indistinguishable from the surrounding landscape. Revealing the entrance required moving many boulders, all of which weigh multiple tons, in a precise pattern which corresponds to a numerical value, perhaps of some significance to the Ancient Guardians.
We are now ready to enter.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Aggression Unlocked 2

GameEventAction.Description:
We did not know what to expect from the Vault of Aggression. Some suspected a massive munitions laboratory or a weapons testing range. The truth is far more sedate. The interior of the Vault is warmly lit and contains comfortable furnishings. Soothing music plays softly. In the center of an arrangement of colorful plants stands a platform containing a single data crystal encased in a translucent sphere.
When our explorers touched the sphere, the chambers immediately filled with a dense cloud. Our analysis revealed that this cloud contained a virus designed to target Shakturi biology. It should have no effect on other species.
Did the Ancient Guardians believe that the relaxing mood of the Vault would confuse the Shakturi? We know very little of how the Ancient Guardians think, or how they understand biological cognition. Regardless, we hope the contents of this Vault will provide new tools to use against our great enemy.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of Aggression Unlocked 3

GameEventAction.Description:
The Vault also contains a small quantity of carefully preserved Loros Fruit. The accompanying data informs us that this resource will be vital to the war effort. The Shakturi use it to further their biowarfare efforts. We, in turn, can use it to defend ourselves or even to create our own plagues to use against the enemy.
Controlling Loros Fruit and keeping it from enemy hands must be a major priority.

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Vault of the Shakturi Mind

GameEventAction.Description:
We have discovered what we believed to be no ordinary Ancient Guardian Vault. All evidence suggests that this is the primary repository of their most secret Shakturi knowledge. On the surface all we have found, however, is a cylinder composed of an unknown metal. It stands approximately six meters in height and three meters in diameter.
The cylinder is encrusted with curious mineral deposits whose precise composition eludes our analysis. Curiously, we can find no evidence that these deposits have formed anywhere else on this world.
Our scientists suspect that the minerals not only contain the key to unlocking the Vault, but that they must be analyzed in ways that would, perhaps, confound Shakturi intelligence. If we are to gain the secrets within, we will have to begin studying the deposits immediately.

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Unlocked

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description:
Or scientists have completed their analysis of the mineral deposits found at the cylindrical Ancient Guardian Vault. There were instructions carefully embedded within the molecular code of the artificially created mineral deposits. These instructions detailed the means of creating a second chemical compound which must be applied to the exterior of the cylinder, which we now know is called the Vault of the Shakturi mind.
The data within the code also informs us that we must have a qualified scientists on hand to work whatever equipment is in the Vault. We are warned that the process can be a bit… intense. There is a possibility that our scientists could be incapacitated.
Assign a scientist?
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Assign Scientist
Vault of the Shakturi Mind Don't Assign Scientist

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Don't Assign Scientist

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description: It is not worth the risk to our scientists.

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Assign Scientist

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description:
Our team has arrived on {0} and is ready to apply the secondary mineral deposit and open the Vault of the Shakturi Mind.
Inside the Vault, we have discovered a single workstation and a headset designed to adjust to a variety of head shapes. There are some instructional pictograms that make it clear our scientists is supposed to put on the headset. The pictograms also suggest there is a chance our scientist might be killed.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Success
Vault of the Shakturi Mind Failure

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Success

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description:
Mere seconds after putting on the headset, our scientist fell to the floor, unconscious. Upon being revived, our scientist described spending weeks on board a Shakturi ship, as a Shakturi, going about the ordinary business of a member of the crew.
These memories are now all fragmentary, however. Our scientist remembers the experience of being on board a massive Shakturi ship, unlike anything our species has ever conceived of. This ship had the power to destroy entire planets. Our scientist recalls watching as a planet inhabited by billions was torn apart, experiencing this horror from a Shakturi perspective and feeling.... satisfaction.
Our scientist the emergence of another memory. It appears that the ancient Shakturi came to this galaxy with a virus already prepared, targeting a specific species. Our scientist did not know which one, but this information suggests there may be some purpose other than pure conquest to the Shakturi presence here.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Unlocked 4

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Failure

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description:
Our scientist has been killed! There was no struggle or even the appearance of distress. The headset was activated and death followed immediately.
An autopsy suggests that some individuals simply cannot tolerate the headset. There is no way to know who can survive until someone succeeds.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Second Attempt Choice

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Second Attempt Choice

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description: Is it worth another attempt?
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Second Attempt
Vault of the Shakturi Mind Don't Assign Scientist

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Second Attempt

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Success
Vault of the Shakturi Mind Failure 2

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Failure 2

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description: Again our scientist has been killed! Is it worth another attempt?
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Third Attempt
Vault of the Shakturi Mind Don't Assign Scientist

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Third Attempt

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Success

GameEvent.Name: Vault of the Shakturi Mind Unlocked 4

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: The Vault of the Shakturi Mind
GameEventAction.Description:
Once the fog of this experience had lifted, the scientist revealed that the technology to counter the Shakturi Planet Destroyers is contained within the headset.
If that is true, and we can extract this knowledge, then today will go down as a major turning point in this war.
The headset also has information on the ancient Xaraktor Virus, a very advanced bio-weapon which was being developed to target the Shakturi. Unfortunately, it will need a great deal of additional research to make it less deadly to other species.

We've reached the source of the energy signature similar to the galactic rim beacon and discovered a massive structure, which seems to have recently emerged from deep within the world's crust. It must have been hidden there undetected for centuries.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Encounter Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 2 First
Encounter Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 2 Not First

GameEventAction.Description:
We believe this facility was left by the Shakturi long ago, when they retreated after the great Cataclysm. In all likelihood, the contents were meant to facilitate a second Shakturi invasion.
We know so little about our enemies, but from what we can glean, this structure is likely an archive of some kind. Whatever these vaults contain may be of immense value to us. Perhaps it will be possible to turn our enemies' knowledge against them.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Encounter Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 3 First
ShakturiArchiveInvestigated

GameEvent.Name: Encounter Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 2 Not First

GameEventAction.Description: We believe we have discovered another Shakturi Archive. This one seems dedicated to Biowarfare. As appears to be standard with these structures, this massive Archive is well defended, and our forces will face a fierce battle if we approach. We must expect punishing losses, and yet this is too great a prize to leave in Shakturi hands.

Doing so will not be easy. The revealed structure is no mere outpost, but a vast, impressive base, overwhelming in size and mysterious in purpose. It is constructed with alien geometry and symmetry, unlike anything built by known sentient species. Preliminary scans suggest it is well defended, and our forces will face a fierce battle if we approach. We must expect punishing losses, and yet this is too great a prize to leave in Shakturi hands.

Our scans of the now accessible Shakturi Archive reveal that despite destroying the facility's deadly defenses, we are not safe to enter. The Archive appears to contain Shakturi knowledge regarding Biowarfare and is protected by a series of complex and confounding security measures. Our scientists believe failure to circumvent them could lead to disastrous results. The Shakturi are masters of advanced technology we do not fully comprehend, and hastily breaching the Archive could have negative consequences not only for our explorers but for our entire population.
It may be possible to open the facility without conducting any further research, but our scientists are adamant that rushing would be foolish and dangerous.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Commit to Research
Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research

GameEventAction.Description: We have completed our research into accessing the Shakturi Biowarfare Archive, and our scientists believe we can safely proceed with our exploration.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Commit to Research
Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 2

GameEventAction.Description: This is war. We don't have time to undertake unnecessary research projects. We'll explore the Archive and take our chances.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Success
Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Failure

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Success

GameEventAction.Description:
Perhaps the dangers of proceeding without conducting research were overblown. Granted, we had to avoid a variety of dangerous traps and some of our scientists believe we were very fortunate to do so, but results are what matter.
We have begun to explore the Shakturi Archive without negative consequences.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Failure

GameEventAction.Description:
We should not have acted in haste. One of our explorers has contracted a plague at the Archive and it has spread to one of our worlds.
The Shakturi have abilities beyond our understanding, and it was foolish to walk into one of their traps.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Biowarfare Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEventAction.Description:
Moreover, we have lost a valued contributor to our war efforts. One of our Scientists has fallen to the plague.
We must now proceed with the proper research and return to the Archive when we have learned how to safely explore it.

In the subterranean Archive, we discovered a cache of documents from the Ancient Galaxy concerning Shakturi biological warfare. There are notes here on the various species of our galaxy, denoting strengths and weaknesses. They appear to view intelligent life with clinical detachment, as though all that interests them is how such life can be destroyed.
They are a truly alien species. We dare not lose to them.

We've reached the source of the energy signature similar to the galactic rim beacon and discovered a massive structure, which seems to have recently emerged from deep within the world's crust. It must have been hidden there undetected for centuries.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Encounter Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive 2 First
Encounter Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive 2 Not First

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive Forego Research Failure

GameEventAction.Description:
We should not have acted in haste. A massive swarm of Rift Striders have emerged from some kind of underground stasis to defend the Archive. We cannot hope to explore further without first eliminating these creatures.
The Shakturi have abilities beyond our understanding, and it was foolish to walk into one of their traps.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: ShakturiGeneticRiftStridersKilled

Investigate Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Genetic Engineering Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEventAction.Description: We have destroyed the alien creatures defending the Archive, but our scientists remain certain that another hasty attempt to gain entry will only produce yet another spawning of Rift Striders. We must now conduct the research we had hoped to avoid.

This Shakturi Genetic Engineering archive dates back to the ancient galaxy and is much decayed. Nevertheless, there is much here that we can discover. This appears to have once been a repository of knowledge on genetic engineering. Moreover, it was also a laboratory, which creatures were developed and iterated upon.
Here we found the remains of portions of several space creatures. Even though we only have a few fragments, we can tell that these are earlier prototypes of the creatures the Shakturi have only recently unleashed into our galaxy. Nevertheless, it is now clear that these creatures were long part of the Shakturi conquest plan. In the time since the ancient war, they appear to have perfected their creations.
Once we analyze the fragmentary data we've found here, we believe it will help us fight the Shakturi and their monstrous creations.

We've reached the source of the energy signature similar to the galactic rim beacon and discovered a massive structure, which seems to have recently emerged from deep within the world's crust. It must have been hidden there undetected for centuries.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Encounter Shakturi Psychic Archive 2 First
Encounter Shakturi Psychic Archive 2 Not First

GameEventAction.Description:
We believe this facility was left by the Shakturi long ago, when they retreated after the great Cataclysm. In all likelihood, the contents were meant to facilitate a second Shakturi invasion.
We know so little about our enemies, but from what we can glean, this structure is likely an archive of some kind. Whatever these vaults contain may be of immense value to us. Perhaps it will be possible to turn our enemies' knowledge against them.

As appears to be standard with these structures, this massive Archive is well defended, and our forces will face a fierce battle if we approach. We must expect punishing losses, and yet this is too great a prize to leave in Shakturi hands.

Doing so will not be easy. The revealed structure is no mere outpost, but a vast, impressive base, overwhelming in size and mysterious in purpose. It is constructed with alien geometry and symmetry, unlike anything built by known sentient species. Preliminary scans suggest it is well defended, and our forces will face a fierce battle if we approach. We must expect punishing losses, and yet this is too great a prize to leave in Shakturi hands.

Our scans of the now accessible Shakturi Archive reveal that despite destroying the facility's deadly defenses, we are not safe to enter. The Archive appears to contain Shakturi knowledge regarding Psychic Warfare and is protected by a series of complex and confounding security measures. Our scientists believe failure to circumvent them could lead to disastrous results. The Shakturi are masters of advanced technology we do not fully comprehend, and hastily breaching the Archive could have negative consequences not only for our explorers but for our entire population.
It may be possible to open the facility without conducting any further research, but our scientists are adamant that rushing would be foolish and dangerous.

GameEventAction.Description: We have completed our research into accessing the Shakturi Psychic Defense Archive, and our scientists believe we can safely proceed with our exploration.

Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive 3

GameEventAction.Description: This is war. We don't have time to undertake unnecessary research projects. We'll explore the Archive and take our chances.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Success
Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Failure

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Success

GameEventAction.Description:
Perhaps the dangers of proceeding without conducting research were overblown. Granted, we had to avoid a variety of dangerous traps and some of our scientists believe we were very fortunate to do so, but results are what matter.
We have begun to explore the Shakturi Archive without negative consequences.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Failure

GameEventAction.Description:
We should not have acted in haste. Our attempts to breach the Psychic Defense Archive have set off a hidden psychic trap. One of our scientists has vanished within the archive and our searches have been in vain. We now hear whispers in their voice echoing through the cavernous halls but can find no other trace. The rest of our team is having unsettled dreams in which they feel like they are communicating with an alien consciousness.
The Shakturi have abilities beyond our understanding, and it was foolish to walk into one of their traps.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEvent.Name: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive Forego Research Failure 2

GameEventAction.Description: We must now proceed with the proper research and return to the Archive when we have learned how to safely explore it.

Our explorers have entered the Shakturi Psychic Defense Archive buried under the surface of this world but reported it was entirely empty. It appears it was raided long ago, perhaps by pirates. We have no way of knowing what knowledge has been lost, but appears we came here for nothing.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Investigate Shakturi Psychic Archive 3

GameEventAction.Description:
Or did we? We were prepared to leave the archive when several members of our crew fell ill and became disoriented and confused, convinced that their quarters or their workstations were entirely empty.
Their delusion seemed too similar to what our explorers found on the surface. We rescanned the world and found a device responsible for the low level of psychic energy we detected earlier.
Once we destroyed the device, we re-examined the archive and found it was not empty after all. The ancient Shakturi clearly set up this device so anyone finding it would overlook their records. Those records are much decayed, but there is still much for our researchers to review. We believe this review will grant us a much greater understanding of Shakturi psychic offensive and defensive capabilities.
